image.altText: A middle aged white woman with long brown hair putting dentures in

props.synopsis: Patients across the country have been left with no teeth and drained superannuation accounts after clinics run by a NSW company were placed into administration.

title.children: No teeth, missing super: 'Nightmare' as 'predatory' dental clinics collapse

image.altText: Generic hospital equipment in a patient's room.

props.synopsis: Imported IV fluids containing as much as 12 times more air than those made in Australia are posing a heightened air embolism risk in emergencies for clinicians to manage.

title.children: Air inside imported IV fluid bags is posing an extra risk in emergencies

image.altText: Sussan Ley in press conference

props.synopsis: It's not all that long since Labor had its own dragging, painful, exhausting split over an issue on which its opponents were jubilantly united.

title.children: Before the Coalition was so divided on climate, Labor had its own splits

image.altText: Two police officers stand with their backs to the camera on an empty street, which also has been taped off with police tape

props.synopsis: Officers say a 53-year-old man they arrested after a car ploughed into large crowds of people in Liverpool, north-west England, earlier this week has not yet been charged.

title.children: Police suspect Liverpool parade crash driver may have been drug-affected

image.altText: An adult lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: The Healthscope collapse has exposed the often-conflicting goals between government responsibility for health services and subsidised but privately run institutions looking to maximise profit.

title.children: Healthscope's near-death experience. Can care make cash?

image.altText: US bank notes pictured on a black background

props.synopsis: It is a threat to Australian borrowers on fixed-interest mortgages, and a concern for anyone with exposure to US assets, including through superannuation.

title.children: Some 'panic' as US dollar dive pressures Australia's superannuation pool

image.altText: a young woman wearing a hijab and glasses walks past a group of journalists

props.synopsis: The independent senator for WA says she made a formal complaint that was escalated to the Parliamentary Workplace Support Service.

title.children: Senator discloses 'inappropriate' behaviour by senior parliamentary colleague

props.synopsis: Specialised imagery equipment fitted to planes flying over flood-impacted NSW show the devastating impact the Mid North Coast floods have had on the state's farmland.

title.children: 'Staggering': Aerial photos show impact of flooding on NSW farmland

image.altText: Tina Lombardo

props.synopsis: Nearly four years after Australia's multi-billion-dollar cosmetic surgery industry sparked outrage and was subjected to long overdue reforms, the sector hasn't done enough work.

title.children: 'Staff too fearful to speak out': Cosmetic surgery sector is a work in progress

image.altText: Three fighter jets in the sky.

props.synopsis: An online report suggests Indonesia is contemplating buying second-hand fighter aircraft from China and Russia.

title.children: Indonesia reportedly considering buying Chinese and Russian fighter aircraft

image.altText: A table with lots of long knives laid out.

props.synopsis: Victoria will introduce a ban today on selling machetes after knife-wielding youth gangs brawled at a shopping centre in Melbourne's north. Here's what we know.

title.children: Victoria will ban machete sales from today. Here's what we know

image.altText: Hospital buildings.

props.synopsis: A surgeon is speaking out after hospital management re-categorised the urgency of some cancer surgeries from highest to lowest without consulting him.

title.children: Senior doctor blows whistle and NSW Health launches review into claims about major hospital

image.altText: A group of rugby league players celebrate winning the State of Origin series

props.synopsis: It has been three decades since Paul Vautin's miracle Maroons pulled off the greatest upset in State of Origin history, and the story of Queensland's unlikeliest heroes shows no signs of slowing down.

title.children: Thirty years on, the story of the 1995 Origin miracle still being told

image.altText: Rhiannon DV Interview

props.synopsis: Rhiannon Purcell is fighting to extend an ADVO against her ex-husband — and she claims NSW Police and the courts have only let her down.

title.children: 'My kids are scared': DV survivor left to fight for her own protection

image.altText: King Charles walking down a honour guard, surrounded by soldiers wearing Canadian red.

props.synopsis: The monarch opens Canada's parliament with a speech widely seen as a rebuke of the US president's aggressive comments about its sovereignty.

title.children: King Charles declares Canada 'strong and free' amid Trump rhetoric

image.altText: Prabowo Subianto, presidential candidate.jpg

props.synopsis: The ABC understands several historians have resigned from a controversial project to write an official history of Indonesia, which critics say leaves out key events, including human rights abuses.

title.children: Prabowo was a key player in history. Now, his government is rewriting it

image.altText: A close-up of a koala's face, partially obscured by among gum leaves.

props.synopsis: Australia's iconic marsupial is up against a chlamydia epidemic, vehicle strikes and feral animal attacks. It is also under threat from the creep of urban development into its habitat.

title.children: Koalas under threat from urban creep and chlamydia

image.altText: A clean-shaven, tanned man with short, white hair and a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr described it as a "commonsense" decision grounded in science.

title.children: US will no longer recommend COVID-19 vaccine for children

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: A week after hosting her in-laws for a deadly mushroom lunch, Erin Patterson told police officers she was still trying to understand what had gone fatally wrong, a murder trial jury has heard.

title.children: 'I loved them': Erin Patterson's police interview played to court

image.altText: A grader lays bitumen for a new road.

props.synopsis: New research shows that China has emerged as the world's largest debtor for developing nations, which are due to pay back at least $54 billion to Beijing this year.

title.children: China now 'more debt collector than banker' to developing world

image.altText: A mean wearing glasses and a hat wearing a backpack with forest in the background.

props.synopsis: There's no international standard for how trail running events are measured, which is hindering the sport from being taken more seriously.

title.children: This man wants to bring trail running to the Olympics

image.altText: A man takes a selfie at an outdoor bar

props.synopsis: Legal experts say Lamar Aaron Ahchee is facing very serious drugs charges in Bali, but recent changes to the Indonesian legal system might work in his favour.

title.children: New death penalty rules could help Aussie arrested in Bali, experts say

image.altText: Trump time cover 2024

props.synopsis: TIME's longtime creative director tells the ABC incumbent US President Donald Trump has created a unique challenge for the magazine.

title.children: Treating Trump with 'respect': TIME magazine on capturing the US president

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks into microphones at a media conference standing in front of Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price.

props.synopsis: Liberal insiders have expressed their frustration that the Coalition pushed the Voice as an election issue instead of the issues most Australians were preoccupied with.

title.children: Liberals express frustration the Voice became an election campaign issue

image.altText: A double story house being build with timber frames at the top and a builder to the left and far right

props.synopsis: What if there was a way to build 12 per cent more homes a year with no extra construction workers? Economists say there might be.

title.children: 'Small business fetishism' pushing up home building costs

image.altText: Police officers' heads seen over the aisle of a supermarket

props.synopsis: Police say the death of an Aboriginal man who was restrained by two officers in Alice Springs will be investigated as a death in custody.

title.children: Man dies in custody after altercation with Alice Springs security guard

image.altText: Offred looks into the camera with an evil eye

props.synopsis: Beleaguered fans have watched June suffer through six seasons over eight years in a bid to free herself and save her daughter. Now the season finale offers them hope of some relief — but does it deliver? (Warning: spoilers ahead.)

title.children: Handmaid's Tale finale: Does June Osborne's death stare finally deliver on promise to Gilead?

image.altText: Firefighters survey Beechworth blaze

props.synopsis: Volunteer firefighters in Victoria's north-east say two battery energy storage system proposals would be a catastrophic fire risk if they are approved.

title.children: 'Thermal runaway': The danger with lithium-ion battery plants in the bush

image.altText: A large column of black smoke rises into the air in the horizon with dozens of multi-storey housing blocks in the foreground

props.synopsis: Chinese state media reports that 19 people were also injured and another six are missing following the blast.

title.children: At least five people killed in huge explosion at chemical plant in China

image.altText: A portrait of winston churchill

props.synopsis: A Canadian man who stole an iconic portrait of a scowling Winston Churchill has been sentenced to two years in jail, according to local media.

title.children: Canadian man who stole 'Roaring Lion' portrait sentenced to jail

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair in a composite with a woman with brunette hair.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Senator Jacqui Lambie has been re-elected, while Pauline Hanson's daughter Lee has missed out, as results are finalised from the May 3 federal election.

title.children: Lambie successful, Hanson misses out, as Senate results finalised

image.altText: kami rita

props.synopsis: Kami Rita, 55, first climbed Everest in 1994 and has done so almost every year since.

title.children: Nepali 55yo breaks own record for the most climbs of Mount Everest

image.altText: A woman with dark hair standing outside a concrete building

props.synopsis: Lauren Ingrid Flanigan, 32, who is charged with murder, did not appear when her case was mentioned in the Bundaberg Magistrates Court.

title.children: Mother charged with murder of her three-year-old daughter

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Police have renewed their appeal for information or sightings of a Grey Hyundai ix35 around the Gin Gin area on May 15 to 18.

title.children: Mystery around last known movements of missing teen Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: An ice rink surrounded by black chairs.

props.synopsis: The Australian Institute of Sport transforms a basketball court into an ice rink for the Canberra Brave. The rink is the first in the league to have full bowl seating.

title.children: Australian-first ice hockey rink takes over AIS basketball court
